title: Teenager on 'girly weekend' among four injured in Arndale knife attack
text:
A teenager from Northern Ireland on a “girly weekend” in Manchester was among four people who suffered severe wounds after a man went on the rampage in the Arndale shopping centre.

Chloe McCurk, 19, was said by friends to be “on the mend” after a knife wielding 40-year-old slashed wildly at her before being caught and pinned to the ground by police officers.

Miss McGurk, from Glengormley, County Antrim, is understood to have had surgery, although her injuries are not believed to be life-threatening.

The 40-year-old from Manchester was initially arrested on suspicion of the commission, preparation and instigation of an act of terrorism, but was later assessed by specialist doctors and compulsorily detained under the Mental Health Act.

Greater Manchester Police said on Saturday the investigation would continue to establish whether there were any political or ideological motives behind the attack.

The force added that there was not thought to be any wider threat to the communities of Greater Manchester and that the suspected attacker is believed to have acted alone.
